EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Cable Factory at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of the following interconnected production components:
• Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
• Factory burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) (placed using direction RIGHT)
• Secondary burner inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5) (adjacent to the factory inserter)
• Assembling machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5) that completes the copper-cable production interface

### Extraction System at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5)
Consists of the following entity:
• Extraction system burner inserter at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with its drop position at Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5)
  
### Belt Depot at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Designed as an isolated belt target for material routing, it consists of:
• Wooden chest (belt depot) at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
• Transport belt segment adjacent to the chest at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5)
• Depot burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) (placed with direction UP; its pickup is positioned at the depot chest)

### Electricity Generator at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
This power-production module is composed of interconnected energy‐producing entities:
• Steam engine (named “steam-engine”) at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
• Boiler at Position(x=-5.5, y=24.0)
• Offshore pump at Position(x=-7.5, y=25.5)

ERROR TIPS

• Belt connection target errors
 – Transport belt connection failures repeatedly occur because the belt was attempted to be linked directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object. Always verify that the target entity is an inserter (or similar valid input device) to properly receive items.

• Placement proximity issues
 – An error when placing a wooden chest at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) was caused by the target being too far from the player’s current position. Ensure the player moves within the allowed placement range before attempting placement.

• Undefined reference in variable assignment
 – A NameError indicated the variable ‘target_chest’ was not defined when used to set a final target. Confirm that all entity reference variables are properly declared and assigned before use.

• Inventory availability checks
 – An error stating “No wooden_chest in inventory” occurred during a placement attempt. Verify that the required item is present in the inventory before initiating any build action.
